glsa.title: WordPress: Arbitrary command execution
glsa.synopsis: WordPress fails to sufficiently check the format of cached username data.

background.p: WordPress is a PHP and MySQL based content management and publishing system.

description.p: rgod discovered that WordPress insufficiently checks the format of cached username data.

impact.p: An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands by sending a specially crafted username. As of Wordpress 2.0.2 the user data cache is disabled by default.

workaround.p: There are no known workarounds at this time.

resolution.p: All WordPress users should upgrade to the latest available version:
